TITLE: There’s a new 1% tax on stock buybacks — here's what it means for your portfolio
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden's new 1% excise tax on corporate stock buybacks adds a new levy to the controversial practice. Here's how it may affect investors.

TITLE: Look beyond Barcelona. Here’s where locals travel in Spain
SUMMARY: From beaches with crystal clear water to new luxury hotels in Madrid, Spanish residents tell CNBC where they love to go.

TITLE: The 5 most expensive cars up for sale at Pebble Beach this weekend
SUMMARY: Auction sales at the Monterey Car Week are expected to total between $300 million and $490 million.

TITLE: Yellen: These are the 4 top priorities for the nearly $80 billion in IRS funding
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has outlined four priorities for the $80 billion in IRS funding and requested a plan within six months.

TITLE: What to know about adding a ‘green’ investment fund to your portfolio, now that Biden signed historic climate bill
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed the Inflation Reduction Act, a historic climate measure. Here's how investors can buy funds with an environmental focus.

TITLE: 'Company loyalty will make you poor': Early retiree credits his $1 million net worth to these 7 ‘unpopular opinions'
SUMMARY: Self-made millionaire Steve Adcock retired early in his mid-30s. He got rich the old-fashioned way, by working a 9-to-5 and saving and investing wisely. He also attributes his financial success to seven unpopular life and money rules.

TITLE: Mark Cuban's advice for his younger self and anyone starting their career: Learn to 'be a salesperson'
SUMMARY: Billionaire Mark Cuban said if he could tell his younger self one thing, it would be to do exactly what he was already doing: "Be a salesperson."

TITLE: The world's largest sovereign wealth fund loses $174 billion in the first half, cites inflation and war in Europe
SUMMARY: The $1.3 trillion fund returned a negative 14.4% during the period, as stocks and bonds reacted violently to global recession fears and skyrocketing inflation.

TITLE: Looking for an offbeat European holiday? This island has its own rules, language and vodka
SUMMARY: Accessible via ferry or flight, Jersey has nearly 50 miles of coastline, more sunshine than mainland U.K. and plenty for travelers to do in the Channel Islands.

TITLE: IRS interest rates jump to 6% on Oct. 1. Here’s how much money you’ll get for a missing refund
SUMMARY: If you’re still waiting on a tax refund, you may be earning interest on your unpaid balance, and the rate jumps to 6% on Oct. 1, according to the IRS.

TITLE: CNBC Chairman Mark Hoffman to step down in September
SUMMARY: CNBC Chairman Mark Hoffman will step down next month after running the network since 2005.

TITLE: Investors flock to green energy funds as Congress passes climate bill. What to know as assets reach ‘new territory’
SUMMARY: There's been a surge of interest in green energy funds as Congress allocates $369 billion for climate change funding. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: If you're facing bankruptcy, here's what experts say to do before, during and after you file
SUMMARY: With inflation rising and government aid waning, personal bankruptcies may start to climb again soon. If you're facing bankruptcy, here's advice from experts.

TITLE: Elon Musk wants to cut this ‘terrible habit’ from his morning routine: ‘I suspect a lot of people do [this]'
SUMMARY: Tesla and SpaceX CEO said he has a "terrible habit" of checking his phone immediately after he wakes up. He wants to swap the habit for a workout routine.

TITLE: Ultra-rich fueling sales of luxury brands despite inflation and recession fears
SUMMARY: High-end luxury brands are reporting strong sales even as retailers catering to more mainstream customers cite a pullback in consumer spending.

TITLE: Investors are piling into high-yield bonds. What to know before adding 'junk' to your portfolio
SUMMARY: With a recent influx of money pouring into high-yield bonds, financial experts urge caution before piling in. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: Malcolm Gladwell, addressing criticism: 'Solitary work' can be done at home but for creative work, 'offices really do matter'
SUMMARY: Author and podcast host Malcolm Gladwell clarifies his remote-work stance after he slammed working from home and was accused of hypocrisy.

TITLE: How do people in Asia-Pacific feel about travel right now? It depends on where they live
SUMMARY: Just because people can travel doesn’t mean they will, especially in Asia-Pacific, where people have taken a more cautious approach toward the pandemic.

TITLE: State, local relief not in cards for residents of high-tax states as House assesses Inflation Reduction Act
SUMMARY: After fighting to repeal the SALT deduction limit, a group of House Democrats say they'll vote for the party's spending package without SALT reform.

TITLE: Self-made millionaire: 'Don't buy a home—unless you can afford to waste money'
SUMMARY: Should you buy a home right now? Real estate expert Grant Cardone says yes—but only "if you can afford to waste money." Owning a home isn't always a great investment, especially during times of rising inflation and high home prices. Here's why the self-made millionaire believes most people are better off renting.

TITLE: Inflation Reduction Act extends 'pass-through' tax break limits for 2 more years. Here's what that means for entrepreneurs
SUMMARY: Senate Democrats' legislation would continue an existing limit on how pass-through businesses can use losses to reduce their tax bills.

TITLE: With the IRS hiring more employees, here's who agents may target for audits
SUMMARY: The Senate approved nearly $80 billion in IRS funding with $45.6 billion for "enforcement." Here's who may be affected by more audits.

TITLE: On rare days, the market rises 5% — or even 10%, Wells Fargo finds. How to make sure you're there for it
SUMMARY: A new Wells Fargo analysis looked at the best 20 days for the S&P 500 between August 1992 and July 2022. Almost half of them occurred amid a bear market.

TITLE: Hawaii is the 'perfect place to retire by the beach,' says millionaire—but there are 3 big downsides
SUMMARY: Sam Dogen's parents retired in Hawaii 15 years ago — and they love it. From health care to home-buying, he shares the both the downsides and benefits of retiring in Hawaii, along with how much money you'd need to live in the beautiful state.

TITLE: Nearly half of Singaporeans want to travel to one place – and it’s not Malaysia
SUMMARY: Japan is the top choice for Singaporean travelers this year, but many are confused about how to get in. A Singaporean travel agent living in Japan explains.

TITLE: Reconciliation bill includes nearly $80 billion for IRS including enforcement, audits: What that means for taxpayers
SUMMARY: Senate Democrats on Sunday passed their climate, health and tax package, including nearly $80 billion in IRS funding. Here's what it means for taxpayers.

TITLE: Self-made millionaire Bethenny Frankel: The most successful people have an ‘unstoppable nature’ that separates them from others
SUMMARY: The most successful people have an "unstoppable nature" that sets them apart from the rest, according to self-made millionaire Bethenny Frankel.

TITLE: As climate change threatens more homes, some properties are getting too costly to insure
SUMMARY: As climate change threatens the U.S. with more natural disasters, it's becoming increasingly costly for Americans to insure their homes, experts say.

TITLE: 'I work just 5 hours a week': This 39-year-old makes $160,000 a month in passive income—a look at his typical day
SUMMARY: After Graham Cochrane lost his audio engineer job in 2009, he started a music blog. Now, what began as a side hustle has turned into a $160,000-per-year passive income stream. Working just five hours a week, here's what his typical day looks like.

TITLE: China, Cairo, Italy: The top ‘travel-inspired’ baby names in the U.S. and the UK
SUMMARY: Instead of naming their kids after biblical figures or the British monarchy, some parents are choosing the names of places that hold meaningful travel memories.
